summary: Audited the full feature/publish-repo history (publication work, tmux guardrails, role front-matter refactor, and retrospective guard). Guardrail docs and notebooks are now consistent, but CI still fails in the sandbox because the Python lint dependencies are missing.

issues.root_cause: The CI harness invokes python-lint, which expects pip, ruff, and black. The sandbox (and local repo) lack these tools in requirements.txt, so make ci stops at python-lint with `pip: command not found` and earlier `ruff` errors.
issues.mitigation: Document and install the lint dependencies before running make ci (e.g., add ruff/black/pipx instructions to README or include them in requirements.txt) or adjust python-lint to skip when tools are absent.
issues.prevention: Bake the Python lint toolchain into the repository (pin versions in requirements-dev.txt or ensure the sandbox bootstrap installs them) so future audits do not hit missing-tool failures.
issues.evidence: Running make ci from feature/publish-repo on 2025-10-12 produced `ruff: command not found` followed by `/Users/.../.agents/adapters/python/env.sh: line 30: pip: command not found` during python-lint.

follow_ups: Decide whether to vendor the lint dependencies (ruff/black) or update the bootstrap instructions so make ci succeeds out of the box.
Optionally simplify the smoke harness so it skips python-lint when dependencies are missing, but record that decision in docs/agents/adapters/python.
